QC.Doc01.description: Are docs treated as code (`docs-as-code` approach), i.e. using a version control system?

QC.Doc01.1.description: Are docs managed in the same repository as code?

evidence.success: Documentation resides in the same repository as code
evidence.failure: Documentation resides in an individual repository, separated from code

QC.Doc02.description: Are docs written using a text-plain markup language?

evidence.failure: Documentation is not written using a markup language

QC.Doc02.X.description: Are docs following a style for the %s markup language?

evidence.failure: Docs are not fully compliant with <%s> standard

QC.Doc03.description: Are docs available in a documentation hosting platform?

evidence.success: Documentation is hosted in an online platform
evidence.failure: Documentation is not hosted in an online platform

QC.Doc06.1.description: Is the software scope outlined in the code repository?

evidence.success: A README file is present in the code repository
evidence.failure: A README file not present in the code repository

QC.Doc06.2.description: Is there a clear path or guidelines on how to contribute to the code?

evidence.success: A CONTRIBUTING file is present in the code repository
evidence.failure: A CONTRIBUTING file is not present in the code repository

QC.Doc06.3.description: Does the project establish a code of conduct for its participants?

evidence.success: A CODE_OF_CONDUCT file is present in the code repository
evidence.failure: A CODE_OF_CONDUCT file is not present in the code repository
